channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Israel attacks southern Lebanon, Hezbollah returns fire as ceasefire talks go on
item.description: Israel struck targets in southern Lebanon in what they say was a pre-emptive strike. Hezbollah returned fire. The increase in cross-border exchanges happens just as ceasefire talks resume.
item.content:encoded: Israel struck targets in southern Lebanon in what they say was a pre-emptive strike. Hezbollah returned fire. The increase in cross-border exchanges happens just as ceasefire talks resume.
item.dc:creator: Carrie Kahn

item.title: As Israel blocks most medical evacuations in Gaza, a family tries to save their baby
item.description: One family in Gaza struggles to save their severely ill baby daughter amidst evacuation orders by Israel’s military.
item.content:encoded: One family in Gaza struggles to save their severely ill baby daughter amidst evacuation orders by Israel’s military.
item.dc:creator: Jane Arraf

item.title: Google will pay California's local news outlets $110 million. Some say it's not enough
item.description: Google reaches a deal to fund local journalism in California. The state was working on legislation to force the tech giant to pay a portion of advertising profits to its struggling news industry.
item.content:encoded: Google reaches a deal to fund local journalism in California. The state was working on legislation to force the tech giant to pay a portion of advertising profits to its struggling news industry.

item.title: Politics chat: Is Democratic enthusiasm at 2008 levels? And, JD Vance struggles
item.description: Democratic enthusiasm is high out of the DNC, but how does it really compare to 2008? Robert F. Kennedy, Jr. endorses the Trump campaign as Trump's running mate seems to struggle.
item.content:encoded: Democratic enthusiasm is high out of the DNC, but how does it really compare to 2008? Robert F. Kennedy, Jr. endorses the Trump campaign as Trump's running mate seems to struggle.
item.dc:creator: Ayesha Rascoe

item.title: Anti-trust lawsuit involving the two biggest grocery retailers starts Monday
item.description: A proposed merger of two grocery giants, Albertsons and Kroger, goes to court tomorrow in a case that could have big implications for consumers.
item.content:encoded: A proposed merger of two grocery giants, Albertsons and Kroger, goes to court tomorrow in a case that could have big implications for consumers.
item.dc:creator: Alina Selyukh

item.title: The Democratic and Republican conventions put on display two versions of masculinity
item.description: Two political conventions, two contrasting displays of masculinity: Republicans with defiant, dominating approaches to manhood and Democrats highlighting roles as fathers and husbands.
item.content:encoded: Two political conventions, two contrasting displays of masculinity: Republicans with defiant, dominating approaches to manhood and Democrats highlighting roles as fathers and husbands.
item.dc:creator: Ayesha Rascoe

item.title: The post-Cold-War nuclear disarmament period is over, Pentagon says
item.description: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe speaks to nuclear expert James Acton from the Carnegie Endowment for International Peace about the dangers of what is being called the new nuclear age.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe speaks to nuclear expert James Acton from the Carnegie Endowment for International Peace about the dangers of what is being called the new nuclear age.
item.dc:creator: Ayesha Rascoe

item.title: 2 months later, Kenyan police are still helping control the situation in Haiti
item.description: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe talks with journalist Widlore Merancourt about the current situation in Haiti, two months after Kenyan police arrived in an effort to help the country's police control violent gangs.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe talks with journalist Widlore Merancourt about the current situation in Haiti, two months after Kenyan police arrived in an effort to help the country's police control violent gangs.
item.dc:creator: Ayesha Rascoe

item.title: The voices that made the news at the Democratic National Convention
item.description: Last week's Democratic National Convention showcased a newly energized party. We hear some of the voices from those four days in Chicago.
item.content:encoded: Last week's Democratic National Convention showcased a newly energized party. We hear some of the voices from those four days in Chicago.
item.dc:creator: Ayesha Rascoe

item.title: How Elton John changed the fortunes of a 4th-tier soccer team in his UK town
item.description: Before Ted Lasso and Wrexham, there was Watford FC – a 4th-tier soccer team in a blighted UK town. In 1976, its fortunes were reversed when the club was bought by a local fan – Elton John.
item.content:encoded: Before Ted Lasso and Wrexham, there was Watford FC – a 4th-tier soccer team in a blighted UK town. In 1976, its fortunes were reversed when the club was bought by a local fan – Elton John.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer
